de.esoco.lib.comm

Class SmtpEndpoint

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.obrel.core.RelatedObject
      • de.esoco.lib.expression.function.AbstractFunction<org.obrel.core.Relatable,Connection>
        • de.esoco.lib.comm.Endpoint
          • de.esoco.lib.comm.SocketEndpoint
            • de.esoco.lib.comm.SmtpEndpoint
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    de.esoco.lib.property.Fluent<Endpoint>, java.util.function.Function<org.obrel.core.Relatable,Connection>, org.obrel.core.FluentRelatable<Endpoint>, org.obrel.core.Relatable

    public class SmtpEndpoint
extends SocketEndpoint
    A socket-based Endpoint that allows to send email to an SMTP server. The endpoint supports encrypted connections (SMTPS) and PLAIN authentication. It does not support STARTTLS so the connection needs to be encrypted from the start (typically on port 465).

    To create an SMTP(S) endpoint it is recommended to invoke the factory method Endpoint.at(String) with a URL containing the host and port, e.g. Endpoint.at("smtps://mail.example.com:465"). Optionally the URL can also contain authentication credentials (i.e. login name and password) before the host name. If not present in the URL the credential must be set on the endpoint instance if the server requires authentication. Credentials set on the instance will take precedence over the URL.

    Furthermore the URL may contain a query part that provides additional parameters. Currently that can be "to" to set the sender and "from" for the recipient email addresses. Sender and recipient in an Email object that is handed over to sendMail(Email) take precedence. If either sender or recipient are missing (i.e. neither defined in the email nor in the URL) the request will fail.
